content.description: Basic face climb with a few variations with the arete on the left and the crack on the right.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: On the smaller face, left of the chimney and main part of the wall.

content.description: A short chimney climb with a big ledge halfway up.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top, on the main wall side of the chimney/corridor.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: At the left side of the main part of the wall, starting just left of the chimney/corridor.

content.description: A good face climb that might make you think for a minute.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: One the face, just past the green fence post.

content.description: Follow the obvious breaks on clean rock. Protects well. A good lead for an aspiring leader. Run it out or sew it up. Would be a really nice climb if only it was longer.
content.protection: Standard rack. Use anchors for "Six" or walk off. Can TR
content.location: Smack dap in the middle of the main face.

content.description: A basic finger crack with slight bend and plenty of face features.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: Right in the middle of the main part of the wall.

content.description: A basic finger crack with slight bend and plenty of face features.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: About 15' from the right side of the main part of the wall.

content.description: Short route face route with a slight overhang.
content.protection: One bolt is missing at the top of this route, the other is good.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: Around the corner at the left end of the whole wall.

content.description: A decent face climb with a ledge in the middle to get your wits about you.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top, about 6' back from the edge.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: Just around the arete near the green fence post.    (Watch for barbed wire on the ground.)

content.description: A little tricky establishing but then cruiser. Protects well. A nice one to practice a couple finger locks/thin hands.
content.location: left side of wall. The left of the two obvious vertical cracks with a shrub near the top (see photo under Five)

content.description: Short route with plenty of good holds and options to use the vertical finger crack.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: About 20' from the left side of the main part of the wall.

content.description: A short face climb to the left side of the wall.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: About 10' from the left side of the main part of the wall.

content.protection: Two bolts at the top.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: At the far right end of the wall, just before the overhang.

content.description: Follow the obvious cracks up the black streak. Short with thoughtful movement on solid rock. Full value. Pumpier than it looks from the ground.Probably doable on gear though pro would be tricky.
content.protection: Gear anchor - may try to add bolted anchor in the future
content.location: Right side of main wall just right of the dihedral (Route Eight). Easiest top access using the gully around the corner to the right.

content.description: A handcrack running up the dihedral with some subtle challenges.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top, on the face just under the lip.   Easiest access to set up a TR is around the back left side of the wall.
content.location: In the dihedral at the right side of the main part of the wall.

content.description:
A good warmup wall with a number of anchors on short face and crack routes. Shaded in the morning, sunny in the afternoon.  

  You will often see random passersby driving by on the dirt roads to cross the tracks, hear target practice at the impromptu dump, and see free range livestock wandering around.
